history.content:
<md>From, [L&S](https://lsadvising.berkeley.edu/majors-minors/double-majors-simultaneous-degrees),

>  No more than two upper division courses overlapping between majors (meaning, no more than two upper division courses can count for both majors)

under "Double Major/Simultaneous Degree Requirements"

Edit: I just saw that you're asking about a _minor_.

I think the rule is one class overall: see "Course overlap rules" in https://lsadvising.berkeley.edu/majors-minors/minors .

The rule has been changing over the years, so it's worth it to schedule an appointment with any of your advisors as they will be familiar with the latest rules. (FWIW, the rule for triple-major overlapping has changed significantly sometime last year, so I wouldn't be surprised if this rule has more nuance than the page says.)</md>

<md>From, [L&S](https://lsadvising.berkeley.edu/majors-minors/double-majors-simultaneous-degrees),

>  No more than two upper division courses overlapping between majors (meaning, no more than two upper division courses can count for both majors)

under "Double Major/Simultaneous Degree Requirements"

Edit: I just saw that you're asking about a _minor_.

I think the rule is one class overall: see "Course overlap rules" in https://lsadvising.berkeley.edu/majors-minors/minors .</md>

<md>From, [L&S](https://lsadvising.berkeley.edu/majors-minors/double-majors-simultaneous-degrees),

>  No more than two upper division courses overlapping between majors (meaning, no more than two upper division courses can count for both majors)

under "Double Major/Simultaneous Degree Requirements"</md>
You have what L&S calls a "complex double major" and they allow two overlaps between the two majors and then one additional overlap between one of your majors and your minor.
You can overlap one upper div course between a major and a minor.
How many courses am I allowed to overlap between my double majors and my CS minor?
history.subject: Course Overlap between Double Major and CS Minor
